meanings.definition: A unit of measurement in Japanese acupuncture, equivalent to approximately one inch.
meanings.sent1: During the acupuncture session, the therapist targeted specific tsubos on my body.
meanings.sent2: The acupuncturist measured the distance between two tsubos on my arm.
meanings.sent3: I joked that my tsubos were like tiny rulers on my skin, guiding the therapist's needles.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers found the tsubos like hidden treasures waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The tsubos felt like secret buttons that, when pressed, released tension throughout my body.

meanings.definition: Plural form of tsubo, a traditional Japanese unit of area measurement.
meanings.sent1: The farmer's land was divided into several tsubos for cultivation.
meanings.sent2: She calculated the total area of the field by counting the tsubos.
meanings.sent3: The tsubos on the map looked like tiny puzzle pieces waiting to be assembled.
meanings.sent4: The tsubos of land stretched out like a patchwork quilt beneath the clear sky.
meanings.sent5: Each tsubos of the garden held a different surprise, from flowers to vegetables.

meanings.definition: A type of pressure point on the body used in traditional Chinese medicine.
meanings.sent1: The therapist applied gentle pressure to the tsubos to release tension.
meanings.sent2: He massaged the tsubos along my back to improve circulation.
meanings.sent3: I imagined my tsubos as tiny buttons that controlled my body's energy flow.
meanings.sent4: The tsubos felt like small wells of energy waiting to be tapped into.
meanings.sent5: With each touch on the tsubos, I felt a wave of relaxation spreading through my body.
